Welcome to durakula’s documentation!¶

The Cards module¶

class Cards.Card(suit_idx: int, value_idx: int)¶

Bases: object

Map keys: (suit, value) to value (string inside _CARD_MAP_FULL). Additional string method outputs card as ‘value’ of ‘suit’ – e.g., ‘Ace’ of ‘Spades’.

class Cards.CardCollection(n_suits: int = 4, n_vals: int = 13, fill=True)¶

Bases: object

First In Last Out collection of Card objects, implemented with collection.deque storing deck order, and np.ndarray representing cards inside the deck.

cut(idx=None)¶
draw(n=1)¶
empty()¶

Empty this deck.

The DurakGame class¶

class Game.DurakGame(deck_mode, n_players)¶

Bases: Game.Game

State machine for game of Durak, a card game for 2-5 players.

get_action_size(field, player_id)¶

Available actions given player

Parameters

player_id (int) – index for player

get_current_player()¶
get_game_ended()¶

Will return 0 if game has not ended, or the player_id, counting from 1 through 5, of the loser of the game.

get_init_field()¶

Initial Field

get_next_state(field, player_id, action)¶

Updates the state of the playing field (Field.DurakField) after player (Agent.DurakPlayer) performs the given action. Resets the playing field if defense is successful or failed. Draws cards for players that have less than six cards while deck (Cards.DurakDeck) is unempty.

Parameters

  • field (DurakField) – Current state of the field.

  • action (tuple) or (str) – Action player will take.

  • player_id (int) – Index of player

Returns

The field after applying action. next_player_id (int): The id of player who plays in the next turn.

Return type

new_field (Field.DurakField)

get_player_id(player)¶
get_valid_moves(field, player_id)¶
Input:

players: current player(s)

Returns

a binary vector of length self.get_action_size(), 1 for moves that are valid from the current board and player, 0 for invalid moves

Return type

validMoves

Base class for games involving more than 2 players.

play(game)¶
class Agent.Player(game)¶

Bases: object

A player object is initialized with the game. Its main function is to take the state of the game (ie the board) as input, and return an action.

play(board)¶

Given the board, return an action.

class Agent.RandomPlayer(game)¶

The DurakField class¶

class Field.DurakField(deck, players, first_player_id)¶

Bases: Field.Field

This class defines legal moves you can make in a game of Durak, given every players’ hands and the current cards played on the field.

clear_field()¶

Clear field after a defender has successfully defended or given up. Make all that aren’t finished in wait mode.

defense_combinations(valid_defenses: numpy.ndarray) → list¶

Returns every possible defense given valid_defenses.

execute_move(move, player_id: int) → None¶

Execute a move for the given player. Evaluates whether the player has finished their game (ie run out of cards) at the end of move.

first_attack_combinations(valid_attacks: numpy.ndarray, L: int) → list¶

The first attack can only be cards of the same value.

get_legal_moves(player_id) → list¶

Returns a list of legal moves. The basic moves are to attack and to defend. If player mode is set to finished or wait, then no move can be performed. A player in defense can always give up. If first attack, then attack must be performed.

has_legal_moves(player_id: int) → bool¶

A player has legal moves so long as their hand isn’t empty.

set_first_attack(first_attack)¶

Boolean layer that is all 1’s if this is indeed the first attack, and all 0’s if not.
